newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore rubber ends mostly flat in thin trade.
newsitem.headline: Singapore rubber ends mostly flat in thin trade.

text.p: Rubber futures closed mostly lower on Tuesday in thin, lacklustre trade with the market seen dipping further in the absence of fresh buying from major consumers, dealers said.

Lower prices in Tokyo, caused mainly by bumper stocks there, weighed on the local market, the traders said. There was no impact on the news about changes in the TSR20 rubber contract which will take effect beginning on November 1.
"There was some slight buying by local dealers, but it was a very quiet market and virtually nothing was done," a local rubber trader said.
"It's the same old song. Trading was very thin," another dealer said.
At around 0945 GMT, December RSS3 was seen at 123.50 U.S. cents a kg from 123.75 cents.
November RSS1 was seen at 172.50-174.50 Singapore cents (US$1.22-$1.24) a kg from the previous settlement of 174.50 cents.
December TSR20 was seen at 170.75-172.75 Singapore cents (US$1.21-$1.22) a kg against 172.75 cents.
